architectures.name: Eiffel Tower
architectures.description: Iconic iron lattice tower built for the 1889 Exposition Universelle, now a global cultural icon.

architectures.name: Taj Mahal
architectures.description: White marble mausoleum built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his favorite wife, Mumtaz Mahal.

architectures.name: Sydney Opera House
architectures.description: Famous performing arts center with distinctive sail-like shells, recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage site.

architectures.name: Great Wall of China
architectures.year_built: Several periods from 7th century BC to 16th century AD
architectures.description: Historical series of fortifications built to protect Chinese states and empires from invasions.

architectures.name: Burj Khalifa
architectures.description: Tallest structure and building in the world, known for its modern architecture and engineering marvels.

architectures.name: Colosseum
architectures.description: Ancient amphitheater used for gladiatorial contests and public spectacles in the Roman Empire.

architectures.name: Guggenheim Museum Bilbao
architectures.description: Contemporary art museum renowned for its innovative architecture, designed by Frank Gehry.

architectures.name: Petronas Twin Towers
architectures.description: Twin skyscrapers briefly known as the tallest buildings in the world, featuring Islamic geometric patterns.

architectures.name: Parthenon
architectures.description: Doric temple dedicated to the goddess Athena, symbolizing ancient Athenian democracy and culture.

architectures.name: Fallingwater House
architectures.description: Residence designed by Frank Lloyd Wright, integrating harmoniously with its natural surroundings.

architectures.name: Sagrada Família
architectures.description: Basilica designed by Antoni Gaudí, known for its intricate facades and ongoing construction since the late 19th century.

architectures.name: Machu Picchu
architectures.description: Ancient Incan citadel situated high in the Andes Mountains, considered one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.

architectures.name: St. Basil's Cathedral
architectures.description: Iconic Russian Orthodox cathedral on Red Square, featuring vibrant onion domes and colorful patterns.

architectures.name: Hagia Sophia
architectures.description: Historical basilica turned mosque and now a museum, recognized for its massive dome and architectural significance.

architectures.name: Neuschwanstein Castle
architectures.description: Fairy-tale castle built by King Ludwig II of Bavaria, inspiring the design of Disney's Sleeping Beauty Castle.

architectures.name: Pantheon
architectures.description: Ancient Roman temple later converted into a church, known for its domed roof and oculus.

architectures.name: Buckingham Palace
architectures.year_built: First completed in 1703; major expansions in 19th century
architectures.description: Official residence of the British monarch in London, featuring iconic balconies and the Changing of the Guard ceremony.

architectures.name: CN Tower
architectures.description: Iconic communications and observation tower, formerly the world's tallest freestanding structure.

architectures.name: Forbidden City
architectures.description: Imperial palace complex spanning over 180 acres, representing traditional Chinese palatial architecture.

architectures.name: Empire State Building
architectures.description: Iconic skyscraper recognized as an emblem of New York City and one of the tallest buildings in the world.

architectures.name: Château de Chambord
architectures.description: French royal castle known for its distinctive French Renaissance architecture, featuring a double helix staircase.

architectures.name: The Shard
architectures.description: Tallest building in the United Kingdom, characterized by its glass exterior and pyramid-like shape.

architectures.name: Potala Palace
architectures.description: Historic residence of the Dalai Lama, featuring towering walls, intricate murals, and numerous Buddhist relics.

architectures.name: St. Peter's Basilica
architectures.description: Principal and largest Catholic church in the world, renowned for its grand dome and artworks by Michelangelo and others.

architectures.name: Guggenheim Museum
architectures.description: Modern art museum designed by Frank Lloyd Wright, known for its unique spiral ramp and contemporary art collections.

architectures.name: Mont Saint-Michel
architectures.description: Island commune topped with a Gothic abbey, surrounded by medieval walls and tidal flats, offering breathtaking views.

architectures.name: The Louvre Pyramid
architectures.description: Glass pyramid entrance to the Louvre Museum, designed by I.M. Pei, serving as a modern landmark within historic surroundings.

architectures.name: Alhambra
architectures.description: Medieval palace and fortress complex featuring intricate Islamic art, gardens, and panoramic views of Granada.

architectures.name: Casa Milà (La Pedrera)
architectures.description: Antoni Gaudí-designed building with undulating stone facade, known for its surreal forms and functional design.

architectures.name: Angkor Wat
architectures.description: Largest religious monument in the world, representing the pinnacle of classical Khmer architecture and Hinduism.

architectures.name: Basilica of the Sagrada Família
architectures.description: Masterpiece by Antoni Gaudí, renowned for its intricate facades, towering spires, and symbolic religious elements.

architectures.name: Dome of the Rock
architectures.description: Iconic Islamic shrine with a gold dome, significant in both Islamic and Jewish traditions.

architectures.name: Cologne Cathedral
architectures.description: Magnificent Gothic cathedral housing the Shrine of the Three Kings and known for its twin spires.

architectures.name: Tiananmen Square
architectures.description: Historic public square in the heart of Beijing, surrounded by significant buildings like the Forbidden City.

architectures.name: Museum of Islamic Art
architectures.description: Architectural marvel designed by I.M. Pei, showcasing Islamic art spanning 1,400 years.

architectures.name: The Pantheon
architectures.description: Well-preserved Roman temple featuring a vast dome with an oculus, now serving as a church.

architectures.name: Chichen Itza
architectures.description: Ancient city featuring the iconic El Castillo pyramid, reflecting Mayan astronomy and culture.

architectures.name: St. Paul's Cathedral
architectures.description: Iconic Anglican cathedral with a dome designed by Sir Christopher Wren, offering panoramic views of London.

architectures.name: Wat Phra Kaew
architectures.description: Temple within the Grand Palace complex, housing the Emerald Buddha, considered the most sacred temple in Thailand.

architectures.name: Rockefeller Center
architectures.description: Iconic Art Deco complex in Midtown Manhattan, featuring the famous Christmas tree and skating rink.

architectures.name: Palace of Versailles
architectures.description: Former royal residence renowned for its opulent interiors, sprawling gardens, and historical significance.

architectures.name: Golden Gate Bridge
architectures.description: Iconic suspension bridge connecting San Francisco to Marin County, recognized worldwide for its beauty and engineering.

architectures.name: Burj al Arab
architectures.description: Luxurious sail-shaped hotel known for its iconic design, located on its own artificial island.

architectures.name: Mesa Verde Cliff Dwellings
architectures.description: Ancient cliffside dwellings of the Pueblo people, showcasing remarkable architectural and cultural heritage.

architectures.name: Borobudur Temple
architectures.description: Largest Buddhist temple in the world, featuring intricate carvings and stupas with panoramic views.

architectures.name: Hearst Castle
architectures.description: Opulent mansion designed by Julia Morgan for newspaper magnate William Randolph Hearst, featuring diverse architectural styles.

architectures.name: Petronas Twin Towers
architectures.description: Twin skyscrapers briefly recognized as the tallest buildings in the world, representing Malaysian aspirations and modernity.

architectures.name: Acropolis of Athens
architectures.year_built: Mostly constructed in the 5th century BC
architectures.description: Historical citadel featuring iconic structures like the Parthenon, symbolizing ancient Greek civilization and democracy.

architectures.name: Monticello
architectures.description: Estate of Thomas Jefferson, showcasing his architectural vision and serving as a reflection of early American ideals.

architectures.name: Gardens by the Bay
architectures.description: Futuristic botanical gardens featuring the iconic Supertree structures, blending nature with sustainable architecture.

architectures.name: Piazza San Marco
architectures.description: Historic public square surrounded by significant buildings like St. Mark's Basilica, reflecting Venetian grandeur.

architectures.name: Chrysler Building
architectures.description: Iconic skyscraper with a distinctive crown, once the tallest building in the world, epitomizing Jazz Age elegance.

architectures.name: Ephesus
architectures.description: Ancient city showcasing well-preserved ruins like the Library of Celsus, representing Hellenistic and Roman architectural influences.

architectures.name: Gateway Arch
architectures.description: Monumental arch symbolizing the westward expansion of the United States, featuring a unique stainless steel design.

architectures.name: St. Basil's Cathedral
architectures.description: Colorful and distinctive cathedral on Red Square, representing Russian architecture and religious artistry.

architectures.name: Buckingham Palace
architectures.description: Official residence of the British monarch, renowned for its grand facade and State Rooms.

architectures.name: Hagia Sophia
architectures.description: Historic marvel transitioning from a cathedral to a mosque and now a museum, with a massive dome and intricate mosaics.

architectures.name: Taj Mahal
architectures.description: White marble mausoleum reflecting Indo-Islamic architecture, built by Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife.

architectures.name: Casa Batlló
architectures.description: Antoni Gaudí-designed masterpiece known for its whimsical facade, representing the pinnacle of Catalan Modernism.

architectures.name: Stonehenge
architectures.description: Mysterious ancient monument composed of massive standing stones, sparking intrigue about its purpose and construction.

architectures.name: The Pyramids of Giza
architectures.description: Iconic ancient structures, including the Great Pyramid, built as tombs for pharaohs and reflecting ancient engineering marvels.

architectures.name: The Shard
architectures.description: Tallest building in the UK, featuring a glass façade and offering panoramic views of London.

architectures.name: Potala Palace
architectures.description: Former residence of the Dalai Lama, symbolizing Tibetan Buddhist culture and architecture.

architectures.name: Leaning Tower of Pisa
architectures.description: Famous for its unintended tilt, this freestanding bell tower is a testament to historical architectural miscalculations.

architectures.name: Sagrada Família
architectures.description: Antoni Gaudí's masterpiece, a basilica known for its unique design, intricate facades, and ongoing construction.

architectures.name: Golden Pavilion (Kinkaku-ji)
architectures.description: Buddhist temple renowned for its gold-leaf exterior, representing harmony between nature and architecture.

architectures.name: Sydney Opera House
architectures.description: Iconic performing arts center with sail-like shells, a UNESCO World Heritage site and symbol of modern Australia.

architectures.name: Machu Picchu
architectures.description: Ancient Incan city set high in the Andes Mountains, showcasing remarkable stone constructions and terraced landscapes.

architectures.name: Neuschwanstein Castle
architectures.description: Fairytale-like castle commissioned by Ludwig II, inspiring the design of Disney's Sleeping Beauty Castle.

architectures.name: Château de Chambord
architectures.description: French Renaissance château with distinctive French architecture, including a central double-helix staircase.
